etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in William Lawrence (1783–1867), surgeon. From epi- + canthus, after German Epicanthus

definitions: A fold of skin overlapping the inner angle (canthus) of the eye.

notes.text: Such folds are present as a normal characteristic in people belonging to certain (mainly East Asian) racial groups, and also as a congenital anomaly (as in people with Down's syndrome).
